comments.body:
I'm unclear here -- is this

(a) a bug fix in our types, where `import { htmlSafe } from '@ember/string';` no longer works entirely in Ember 3.x

or 

(b) A deprecation in Ember 3.x that currently works, but logs a deprecation warning?
Those were my findings as well. I guess remove `@deprecated`. Here's where they changed the docs: https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/pull/16887 (not much info there)
We need to align with Ember's public API. If it's not deprecated there, we should not indicate anything is deprecated here.
Got it, makes sense. Thoughts on if it deserves another RFC to deprecate the exports from `@ember/string`?

It's unclear whether
> 1. Move` htmlSafe` and `isHTMLSafe` to `@ember/template`

(from [the above RFC](https://github.com/emberjs/rfcs/blob/master/text/0236-deprecation-ember-string.md))
would include deprecating the exports from `@ember/string`. Regardless, the current state appears to be that importing from `@ember/string` not yet officially deprecated, just no longer being taught in the guides. Therefore, I agree with @mike-north that we shouldn't indicate deprecation here at this time.
